section.title: Modularity
section.para: A very known word in software development and of course, a lot of software are greatly successful by deciding to make their application extensible, but what does Majisti is exactly adding up to make everything more modular?

The answer is simple, some very popular open-source Web CMS such as Joomla or Drupal do follow modular scalability where users can contribute their separate modules. Majisti is aiming for that philosophical way of thinking. Do not misunderstand, its design is not based on those CMS but the way to contribute extensions as a community. Majisti classes user contribution as an high priority where community driven development is what makes it grow, but it will be used in a much more restricted environment, where the core library is already based on other libraries. Also, Majisti is first and foremost aimed at developers and not users who don't have the required knowledge to develop Web applications. That does not mean that Majisti will never target a more user-oriented base, but its early versions are not focussed on that.
